interview_questions.question: What is HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard language for creating web pages.
It defines the structure and content of a webpage using tags and attributes.

interview_questions.question: What are the key features of HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
Key features of HTML include:
- Semantic structure
- Support for multimedia
- Cross-browser compatibility
- Form creation
- Accessibility support
- Integration with CSS and JavaScript

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between HTML and HTML5?
interview_questions.answer:
HTML is the general term for the markup language, while HTML5 is the latest version.
HTML5 introduces new elements (e.g., <article>, <section>), APIs, and multimedia support without plugins.

interview_questions.question: What is a tag in HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
A tag is a markup element used to define the structure or content of a webpage. Examples include

interview_questions.question: What is an attribute in HTML?
interview_questions.answer: An attribute provides additional information about an HTML element. It is included within the opening tag, e.g., src in .

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration?
interview_questions.answer:
The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration specifies that the document is an HTML5 document.
It ensures browsers render the page in standards-compliant mode.

interview_questions.question: What are semantic elements in HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
Semantic elements clearly describe their meaning to browsers and developers.
Examples include <header>, <footer>, <article>, and <nav>.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag?
interview_questions.answer:
The <meta> tag provides metadata about the HTML document, such as character encoding, viewport settings, or SEO information.
It is placed within the <head> section.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between <div> and <section> elements?
interview_questions.answer:
A <div> is a generic container with no semantic meaning.
A <section> is a semantic element used to group related content, often with a heading.

interview_questions.question: What is the role of the alt attribute in the tag?
interview_questions.answer:
The alt attribute provides alternative text for an image.
It is used for accessibility (e.g., screen readers) and displayed if the image fails to load.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <form> element?
interview_questions.answer:
The <form> element is used to collect user input.
It typically includes inputs like text fields, checkboxes, and buttons.

interview_questions.question: What are the different types of input elements in HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
Common input types include:
- text
- password
- checkbox
- radio
- submit
- file
- date
- email

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between <button> and <input type='submit'>?
interview_questions.answer:
<input type='submit'> is a form-specific input for submitting forms.
<button> is a more flexible element that can be styled and used for various actions.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <a> tag?
interview_questions.answer:
The <a> tag creates hyperlinks to other webpages, files, or locations within the same page.
It uses the href attribute to specify the destination.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between absolute and relative URLs?
interview_questions.answer:
An absolute URL includes the full address (e.g., https://example.com/page.html).
A relative URL specifies the path relative to the current page (e.g., /page.html).

interview_questions.question: What is the role of the <head> element?
interview_questions.answer:
The <head> element contains metadata, links to stylesheets, scripts, and the page title.
It does not display content on the webpage.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between <script> and <style> tags?
interview_questions.answer:
<script> is used to include or embed JavaScript code.
<style> is used to define CSS styles for the webpage.

interview_questions.question: What is an HTML entity?
interview_questions.answer:
An HTML entity is a code used to display reserved characters or symbols.
For example, < represents < and & represents &.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the id attribute?
interview_questions.answer:
The id attribute assigns a unique identifier to an element.
It is used for styling (CSS) or scripting (JavaScript) specific elements.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between id and class attributes?
interview_questions.answer:
An id is unique to one element, while a class can be applied to multiple elements.
Classes are used for shared styling or behavior.

interview_questions.question: What is the role of the <table> element?
interview_questions.answer:
The <table> element is used to display tabular data.
It includes <tr> for rows, <th> for headers, and <td> for data cells.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <iframe> element?
interview_questions.answer:
The <iframe> element embeds another webpage or content within the current webpage.
It is often used for videos or external widgets.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between <b> and <strong> tags?
interview_questions.answer:
<b> is used for visual bold text without semantic meaning.
<strong> indicates important text with semantic emphasis.

interview_questions.question: What is accessibility in HTML?
interview_questions.answer:
Accessibility ensures webpages are usable by people with disabilities.
It involves using semantic HTML, alt text, ARIA roles, and proper structure.

interview_questions.question: What are ARIA roles?
interview_questions.answer:
ARIA (Accessible Rich Internet Applications) roles enhance accessibility by providing additional semantics to assistive technologies.
Examples include role='button' or role='navigation'.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the data-* attribute?
interview_questions.answer:
The data-* attribute stores custom data for an element.
It is accessible via JavaScript and used for dynamic functionality.

interview_questions.question: What is the difference between <ul> and <ol> elements?
interview_questions.answer:
<ul> creates an unordered list with bullets.
<ol> creates an ordered list with numbers or letters.

interview_questions.question: What is the role of the viewport meta tag?
interview_questions.answer:
The viewport meta tag controls the layout on mobile devices.
It sets the width and scale, e.g., <meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1'>.

interview_questions.question: What is the purpose of the <canvas> element in HTML5?
interview_questions.answer:
The <canvas> element provides a drawing surface for graphics and animations.
It is manipulated using JavaScript APIs.
